website_summaries.verdict: A top-selling grooming tool that's ideal for use on dogs and cats. If you are looking for a multi-purpose rake that will work well on most types of fur, this is a great choice.
pros: Like having several grooming tools in one, as it has a double-sided head that rakes, combs, and brushes
cons: Some severe mats might challenge it
Rare reports of the handle coating pealing
Pricier than competitors, but also versatile

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my Goldendoodle
customer_reviews.text: Where has this been all my life?! I just got this brush, and I tried it for 2 minutes. It's all it took to get the knots out. Amazing. No pulling. BUY THIS BRUSH!
customer_reviews.author: Maria A-G

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for poms or matting hair!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! We've been through 2 furminators and a grooming quality steel toothed comb and NOTHING compares to this! We have a Pomeranian with multiple coats who doesn't naturally shed her undercoat without it being brushed out. This cuts her weekly brush time IN HALF! If you have a dog or cat who mats easily, I'd recommend this 1000 times over.
customer_reviews.author: Marlissa

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Brody is not a fan but I love it. It could be a bit sharper though. I bring him to my dirty shop everyday and it does a number on fine hair. It is a much better alternative than using scissors to cut out the mats of hair.
customer_reviews.author: vegas guy

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!!
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING!!! All I can say is buy this especially if you own a golden or two ❤ This will drastically reduce the amount of fur in our house! I am not sure why I'd never heard of an undercoat rake before!
customer_reviews.author: Heather E Adams

customer_reviews.title: Just pulls on the skin
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed this did nothing for my long haired German Sheperd, I brush him regularly but he still gets mats on his hind quarters. I used this brush and it got caught in his fur and pulled on his skin. The Safari comb I ordered worked much better with little to no discomfort for my dog.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Handle doesn't last, and hair sticks to it.
customer_reviews.text: At first I loved this thing for my doodle rescue. She literally develops matts in one day and this seemed to easily and painlessly take care of them. However, less than a month later and the inside teeth are dulled so it's not much better than a simple comb,and the silicone handle always did stick hair to it, but then it completely worked it's way down and off leaving a trail of liquid silicone.... That luckily didn't get it my dogs hair by some miracle. I would have been better off buying a cheaper version of this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Will & Misty

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution!
customer_reviews.text: I have a shih tzu that rolls around with her toys and gets her ears all matted. This toon is the perfect solution to my problem. Work great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great brush, poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Brush was great for brushing out my mini Schnauzer's hair, although it does not break up matted balls. After having and using the brush for just over 2 months, the top, brush portion broke in half off of the handle while I was using it, just underneath the teeth. The plastic just broke (see picture). No, I am not a rough brusher! So because of this, I am quite disappointed in the quality.
customer_reviews.author: KaylaC

customer_reviews.title: Akita Seal of Approval
customer_reviews.text: I have tried so many different dematting and deshedding tools on my long haired Akita and have never been as thrilled as I am today when I tried this one on him. It works so good on him. And it didn't hurt my bad wrist when I used it. It's so comfortable. I highly recommend this to dog lovers of really furry dogs.
customer_reviews.author: The Dog ZooTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Works great to remove "spay" coat.
customer_reviews.text: My Golden Retriever had a halo of fuzz from about mid-side all the way around his body. Many have said it is "spay" coat. I am not sure what is going on, but I was told to try the GoPets Dematting Comb. The person who recommended it told me that she had tried many tools like the GoPet, but none worked except the GoPets. I am trilled with the results. I do not know how it works for dematting, but it has worked wonders on the massive amount of fuzz my boy had all around his body. WE still have some work to do, but it is getting there. Before and after photos attached.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Handle sucks.
customer_reviews.text: As far as it working on hair, it’s great, but I used it one single time before the gel part of the handle separated from the base and all the gooey gel started leaking out while I was brushing, making me a sticky dog hair covered mess. I had to keep stopping and sliding the handle back together and removing the “goo” between brushing sections. Not a quality brush handle.
customer_reviews.author: Skylar D

customer_reviews.title: Last Dematting Tool You'll Ever Need To Buy
customer_reviews.text: Great quality product, can definitely tell it's not cheaply made and another bonus that it has a life time warranty. The handle is my favorite part since it's very comfortable, making dematting that much more easier and helps that it doesn't slip with difficult parts of the fur. Works very well on my long haired pet and great that it's double sided.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Work
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in hopes it would help with my long haired cat's hatred for brushing. It didn't remove any hair, and it pulled more than anything even where there were no mats or tangles.
customer_reviews.author: Amaris Miller

customer_reviews.title: Probably not the best for an already heavily matted pup
customer_reviews.text: This does work a bit on my very matted goldendoodle. I need to get her groomed and will have a better idea once all the mats are shaved and I can use this tool for maintenance as the hair grows back out. I do think it will work well for that purpose. Biggest complaint - the stickly ickly gel in the handle... it feels great on the hand as long as you do not puncture the rubber at all - this this sticky goop oozes out and makes the handle unusable without making a total mess on everything... including your hand and any surface you set the brush on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Persian cat who sheds like crazy! He doesn't like to sit still for me when I try to brush him with a regular brush, but with this brush he actually seemed to like it. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Yelrak Horton

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Results
customer_reviews.text: This is a reasonably amazing device. It strips out the mat a small amount at first and then pulls the balance out without any discomfort to the long hair cat. In fact my cat lays down and rolls over like he is being scratched. Then, where there are no mats it pulls out all of the extra loose hair with a few strokes. The cat has to be more comfortable with the excess hair removed. The two-sided feature allows you to start with the smaller side and then move the the larger side. I have had a couple of these type products in the past. This is the best of them by far.
customer_reviews.author: bhearn

customer_reviews.title: Handle does not hold up
customer_reviews.text: We have had this tool for a few years now. We also have two fairly rough coat Border Collies. Usually we get them to the groomers quarterly and that keeps their undercoats under control. We are behind and I pulled my grooming tools out to give both a few minutes of work on some problem areas. That oh so soft handle? It is now a sticky mass of goo. Hopefully they have a different formula for that material now. The tool works well, the handle has a major flaw. Fix the handle and it is a solid four stars.
customer_reviews.author: Dreamfields

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase ever!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this 10 stars, I would! I have several brushes and combs for separate uses and this one does it all! I have added a picture of my Handi-cat, Milo, who I was fearful to brush, because he would scratch/bite me once I got going using 2 different brushes and a comb. No animals were hurt using the GoPets brush/comb and he couldn't get enough! Thank you for skin-saving product! I am no longer afraid! ''
customer_reviews.author: HappyGrams❤

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!!!!!!!!! Purchasing more to have back up!
customer_reviews.text: This is hands down the BEST TOOL! We tried everything to get the mats off our ten year old cat. We had a vet appointment to get him shaved but can now cancel!!! This arrived in the mail today and just like that the mats are GONE. Our cat is also a very scardy cat and gets nervous with new things. He actually LOVED being brushed down with this. Flinched a little getting the mats off however now that he is mat free he’s wagging his tail and purring to us brushing him with this. What a life savor! And our car is now pain mat free!!! Recommending this to everyone! :)
customer_reviews.author: Jeannine W

customer_reviews.title: MUST HAVE
customer_reviews.text: I have finally found the right tool I been looking for. I have a Australian shepherd and if u know the breed they have alot of hair. Well the thing took off so much hair in just one pass I could not believe it. I was so impressed on the amount that it would take off. I also have a maltipoo that it did not work so good on, but that's fine cuz she don't leave hairs all over the place like my Australian does. So if u have a dog with hair like that breed this is a must have for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Susie

customer_reviews.title: Maybe I’m using it wrong?
customer_reviews.text: So I am confused by this comb. I am not sure whether I am using it correctly. My cat is a very docile and loving kitty, and wouldn’t hurt a fly. Brushing him with this comb has caused him to swat at me multiple times. He has his claws, so it has been painful. He has a few small mats on his back (along his spine), and I thought from the reviews that this comb would be ideal for small mats. It just pulls on them, and that’s when my cat attacks me.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: My cat got this big problem with terribly matted hair on his back
customer_reviews.text: My cat got this big problem with terribly matted hair on his back. I tried so many products to take care of this in a kitty comfortable way. I used it on his back, and he didn't cry or show any indication of being in pain, and the dematting comb pulled out all the clumped tangles, and underneath the tangles was perfectly healthy fur. I am really pleased with the outcome.
customer_reviews.author: gerrithegirl69

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to use on my heavy-coated Golden Retriever. With the two separate heads, it not only removes the heavy undercoat it does a great job on the topcoat. I also appreciate the padded handle. This is a great help if you have a dog with a heavy hair coat. You would find it very useful for a dog with a heavy undercoat.
customer_reviews.author: C. D. Goff

customer_reviews.title: SO MUCH HAIR
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this thing really removes loose undercoat. My Australian shepherd mix has a double coat that's between 1/2" and 2" long. She sheds like it's her duty to cover everything in downy undercoat and thick topcoat, and she hates the Furminator-type brushes (probably because they're scratchy). She doesn't mind the rake nearly as much. Bottom line: It works well for us; I don't have to vacuum twice/week now! It might work well for you, too!
customer_reviews.author: AllieBoBallie

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service!
customer_reviews.text: I did not like this product as it did not work on my cat and it actually hurt him when I tried to use it on him. However, after I submitted this review the people at GoPets kindly and surprisingly refunded my money. That is what I call customer service!! Thank you for being on top of things like this - most firms would not care after the purchase, but you all did and I appreciate it and will remember your excellent customer service for future purchases. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: CMS

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Remarkably complicated little design in a very simple product. Mine just arrived and I had to use it right away because I've got this Maine Coon which has a very thick very undercoat it gets very matted in the winter because she doesn't like to come indoors. and up until now I really had no way of dealing with it. But this beautiful little comb cuts right through the matting it was much less effort than trying to use the steel hairbrush I was using. got out quite a bit of it in just a short grooming she takes only so much but she loves it she just doesn't like to be indoors. Buy it's worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this primarily for my very long-haired and matted Maine Coon cat. She loves it! And so do I. it has removed her mats, and hands-full of very fine, fly-away undercoat. She now comes to me every morning to be combed. My other, shorter haired cats love it too. It makes our lives so much more enjoyable -- and less hairy. My vacuum cleaner appreciates it too!
customer_reviews.author: Paula T.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because of all the glowing reviews. Well, I followed all instructions and the product still hurt my cats, even though other reviews say otherwise. My cats cried when I worked on each matted area and both ended up hissing and running in fear. One cat is still hiding. Like I said, I followed all instructions from other reviews and the product description. My cats were still in pain. Be careful buying this product. It does not deliver as stated. Wish I had never spent the money. Now my two little guys are traumatized.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have a 15 year old shepherd mix fur ball ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a 15 year old shepherd mix fur ball who hates being brushed. She tolerated over a half hour of grooming with this comb
customer_reviews.author: J. Harvey

customer_reviews.title: Uncooperative kitty
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why but our longhaired kitty HATES to be combed. For this reason we don't do it as often as we should and she is prone to mats. This brush allows us to get in a few quick strokes that are highly effective. When I told our vet about the brush we were using he knew exactly what it was and encouraged us to continue doing what we are doing. Kitty is not a fan of any grooming but using this has reduced the stress involved for everyone and her short patience is rewarded with SHEBA snack sticks.
customer_reviews.author: Risakay

customer_reviews.title: oozing out of the handle
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rake a few months ago and really loved using it but now the ends of the handle has started oozing the gel filling. I can no longer use it without getting sticky stuff all over my hands and in my dogs coat. Have had it for about 6-7 months and I have to throw it away.
customer_reviews.author: Mitzi

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This little thing gets tons of fur off of my two German Shepherds! I’ve found that it can tug on the areas where fur is most dense (for my dogs that was their upper shoulders and back of their legs) so I had to be a bit more thoughtful about how I combed. It reminded me of trying to get a comb through too much/tangled hair. That being said, neither of my dogs complained about a thing. And I’m happy so much fur was thinned out. The great thing about this, and what sets it apart, is that it doesn’t just brush surface level fur. It can brush and smooth out the denser part of the coat. I’m pleased.
customer_reviews.author: ABC911

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t do what I needed it to do
customer_reviews.text: Our long-haired cat is indoor/outdoor. One of his favorite outdoor spots is in the mulch of a planting bed. The mulch and burrs routinely tangled in his fur. I had a little success getting a few of his mats out, but this wasn’t effective on the deepest tangles that were next to his skin. Plus, when you do hit a mat while combing through, it’s not a smooth pulling stroke and takes some effort. My cat wasn’t pleased with that effort and didn’t stick around for a full session. We moved on to Plan B, which was taking him to the vet and getting him shaved.
customer_reviews.author: LoveHim

customer_reviews.title: silicone inside the handle
customer_reviews.text: Tbh I did not really have much time to use this brush, firstly cuz my puppy's hair are too fine for this type of brush, and second - my puppy bit on the handle of the brush ( she is teething and biting on everything), but the thing is that the silicon that is inside of the handle ( I suppose to make it more comfortable for holding it), started to leak out...continuously...I guess I could tape it around with the scotch tape or something but did not want to deal with it ...just had to toss it away...You just have to be careful with it and it might work great for you and your dog.
customer_reviews.author: Anika Love

customer_reviews.title: Handle oozes silicone gel
customer_reviews.text: I loved this dematting brush it worked great on our goldendoodle and he even enjoyed being brushed. But the gel filled handle pulled away revealing sticky silicone type material. I ended up cutting the covering completely off and removing the gel. It came off easily and surprisingly no sticky residue on the handle. Now We still have a great dematting brush but with a hard plastic handle, just no squishy handle. I gave this 2 stars because of the handle falling apart after 3 uses. Otherwise it’s a great tool.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Grooming Tool !!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best brush for our Main Coon , he purrs when you brush sensitive areas like his belly and his hind legs.... and the ammount of hair that comes off .... wow... amazing !! I plan to try on my Newfoundland too, I bet it will work just as well. Totally reccomend this grooming tool, excellent quality, comfortable to use, works great , worth every penny!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nina Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Effective
customer_reviews.text: I have two Maine Coons that mat a lot. One has very thick fur and the other has more babyish fur. It works well on the both of them. This comb finds mats that I didn't even know my cats had, and helps me take them out. If it's a really bad mat, it's not going to remove it, but it's effective on all the smaller mats. As others have said, start with the wider teeth, in small sections, then go over with the other side. It takes out a lot of fur. My cats behaved through it all. I wish I bought this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't rip hair, just removes the dead
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS TOOL!!! So much better than the Furminator which sounds like it's tearing the hair. This gently removes the hair and is pretty dang good on mats too. First photo is the same dog, if you can believe that. When I met her she was covered in mats and hunks of dead hair just longing for removal. After two weeks of brushing and finishing up with this tool, she's gorgeous and happy. Second photo is my dog. She is a well groomed Golden, brushed all the time, but this tool really got down into her undercoat and removed what was shedding and she is happily basking in the sun without carrying around all that fly away hair.
customer_reviews.author: The Salty Dog

customer_reviews.title: Terrible. Does not work. Save your money.
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand how this expensive dematting tool has such high ratings. Don't be fooled, it does not work. Unless, we got a "lemon", that's possible...I guess. It DOES NOT cut through matted dog hair. It pulls worse than our regular brush. We have two Pomeranians with lots of hair, obviously, and were excited to try this product. We could see by looking at it, that the "blades" are not sharp, even dinged up a little. It came in a sealed package, but it's almost like it's an old one that has been used for years and needs to be thrown away. We are extremely dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: review4u

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product works as described
customer_reviews.text: I don’t understand how this works but it gets out so much hair. It is a simple hook like design but it removes that under fur so thoroughly and deeply we were stunned by how much hair it got out. We comb our cat every day with a cat comb and this still got out more hair then we could hold in our two hands. Amazingly the cat does not mind at all and purrs and rubs against it when I go to use it. VERY impressed!!! We found the side with fewer hooks works better than the one with a lot, not sure what that side is for.
customer_reviews.author: W. Reagan

customer_reviews.title: Great for long haired cats!
customer_reviews.text: We have a long haired cat with a thick coat who constantly gets knots in her hair. We have tried many types of brushes including the furminator but they would always catch on the knots and not be able to handle her thick coat. We were debating just trimming all her hair with electric shears...until this brush came along! This brush’s two sides are very helpful for getting through tough knots and maintaining her coat. Just a slight jiggle of the wrist when it gets to a knot will cut right through them. She now has no knots and actually likes getting brushed!
customer_reviews.author: MCA

customer_reviews.title: I love this brush. Shiny dog with almost no more shedding.
customer_reviews.text: I decided to spend the money and hopefully get a good product the first time around. I just rescued a long haired German Shepard/Lab mix. She sheds everywhere. When I got this brush in the mail I immediately used it on her and there was a handful of hair that came out the first swipe. After I finished I could have made a new dog with all of the hair. The best part is she is shiny and doesn't shed all over my house anymore. I also used it on my long haired cat. Worked the same. I love this brush. It is worth the money. I also really like the soft handle.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn D.

customer_reviews.title: Great for Maine Coon Cats!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Really works well on our main coon cat. He had to get shaved in the past when higher temperatures came around. No more embarrassing haircuts! However, the cat bit the handle and now it leaks the gel very slowly, but it doesn't affect the performance of the tool. I'm still very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Coolwagster

customer_reviews.title: Best Mat Remover Ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was shocked when I started using this on my adorable Maine Coon, Ms Windy. She was terribly matted in the white patch of hair on her chest. This remarkable little machined removed the mats with ease and no squirming, crying, scratching and fussing to get down, which as never happened before. I continued and removed almost all of the mats, but she had had enough after a while and wanted to stop and get down so I acquiesced. I have two more Maine Coons that are not as bad as Windy was, but they each have a few mats and now I know that I can remove them quickly and with no pain to my kitties!!
customer_reviews.author: Dee Rob

customer_reviews.title: My perfectly coiffed cat
customer_reviews.text: I just love this device! Unfortunately, being long-haired and somewhat matted despite multiple dailly brushings, my cat loves it a lot less. He still has a good deal of his winter hair from LAST winter, which I'm trying to remove, but it pulls his hair a bit and he bites and then nobody is happy. However, I continue on my mission and can tell you that this comb/brush/device is about the best I've ever seen, and it absolutely does what it says it will, whether the cat likes it or not. Shari E. Carter
customer_reviews.author: Shari E. Carter

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable for my cockapoo
customer_reviews.text: Purchased based on the many excellent reviews. I can’t speak to every dog’s experience but my ~15lb cockapoo at least did not find it at all comfortable to use this brush. Again, I don’t know if it is just my dog or would be similar in other small dogs. I contacted the company via their website based on their advertisements of guaranteed satisfaction but have unfortunately not received a response and now I am also beyond the return window for amazon so I am out of luck. The quality of the brush otherwise seems excellent if it works for your dog.
customer_reviews.author: Dealseeker

customer_reviews.title: Better than the furminator
customer_reviews.text: I don't take my husky/shepherd/lab mix to the groomers since I thought furminating her once a week was adequate enough. (Been using it for 7 years now) But I started to notice the big dogs around my neighborhood looked more luxurious than mine. I decided to give this brush a try and oh my... the amount of tangled under coat hair that came off of my dog was satisfying. Her coat looks so much more healthy and she doesn't look homeless compared to the other dogs in the neighborhood!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Great for arthritis!
customer_reviews.text: I have a huge hi white Maine Coon with beyond silky hair. He manages to weave knots in his arm/leg pits and on his hips. Thankfully, this tool goes right thru them super easily. I’ve found it less painful for him and more effective to brush from his spine straight down to his feet rather than sideways along his sides. I love it for my other Maine Coon who has a somewhat shorter and less silky coat and it’s great on my Applehead Siamese. Plus I’m able to do it all thanks to the amazing gel handle, even with advanced rheumatoid arthritis and moderately deformed hands. I’m sold on this line of grooming gear.
customer_reviews.author: Mother of cats 😺😺😺

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: Meh, I have an Akita and the actual brush seemed well made and probably a good fit for a small dog. But it took me 40 min to.do the smallest section every and then the under coat little fuzz kept getting tangled and stuck in the grooves of the brush. It would probably be better on longer finer hairs dogs and smaller. Probably not the right fit for an dog over 30-40 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Did I get a dull one?
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand the reviews here vs. my experience with this thing. This gets under the mat well enough but instead of any sharp edge cutting anything it pulls my kitty's hair and she cries, "ow". I take my fingers and try to help pull the hair through it to 'cut' but it never seems to actually cut. Sometimes it breaks through but not without a considerable amount of try hard and stress for kitty. Did I get a dull one?
customer_reviews.author: Adree D Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: I have a Rag Doll Cat and a Toy Poodle. I was looking for a brush which could handle their long hair. This "brush" had mostly good reviews so I wasted my money and bought it. It is terrible. The steel tines are very short and thick, really short. The cat loves being brushed, but this "brush" is useless on the cat and was impossible to get through the dog's curly hair. Garbage. I'd give it zero stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: My Opinion

customer_reviews.title: Well made, just not long prongs enough for me
customer_reviews.text: My husky mix is particularly long haired with a massive amount of wool undercoat that forms a layer much like a sheepskin rug. I say this upfront because I have little doubt if she was less wooly this would work perfectly As it is, it is a bit difficult to get deep enough to reach the undercoat, and a bit hard to pull through. An hour yields a half done job at best. I think she needs a longer prong length and wider spacing to start, moving to this one as a second level. I do love the gel handle and the weight of this.
customer_reviews.author: Shadowdancer

customer_reviews.title: Not for my dog
customer_reviews.text: My super coated miniature schnauzer gets very anxious when he is groomed. His coat does tend to tangle and mat. My hope was to use a detangler and this dematting comb to get everything smoothed out before his grooming appointment so that it would be easier for him and sweet groomer. He hated it. It would not go through his coat at all without pulling, even on the wide side. Both the detangler and this comb were a big disappointment. It was not suited for his type of coat. I ended up taking scissors and just cutting out the tangles.
customer_reviews.author: Constant ReaderTop Contributor: Fantasy Books

customer_reviews.title: Not so for sure
customer_reviews.text: I have a miniature schnauzer who every so often will get a knot or two in long air on legs. She is the best natured schnauzer. Friendly, does not bite, I'm always playing with her and so does my family. I've had her 8 years. I tried this GoPets Comb after receiving. I gently tried to brush out knots but she kept stiffening up on me and had her serious face on, saying "don't you dare". Lets put it this way, she did not like.
customer_reviews.author: Annette

customer_reviews.title: Amazing brush
customer_reviews.text: We love this brush. Our cat started getting terrible matting out of nowhere and just brushing her wasn't helping. Now if she gets a matt I can just brush it out and be done. She hates being brushed and screams but the brush does not hurt her at all. It gets all Matt's out easily and painlessly. Best brush ever. I highly recommend for people with animals that get matts. We used it on our collie too and works just as great for him.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works!!
customer_reviews.text: This comb/cutter also does a great job of thinning and cutting hair and mats. I have a 16 month old Bouvier with hair since he was born, and he has had a lot of mats during that time. I really need to groom daily, but this product is very effective in removing Matt's, but it also helps thin the hair almost eliminating the need for clipping. I say almost, because there is still some clipping required, as we live in south Florida where we get 3 weeks if winter. So he will be very comfy for 3 weeks next year, but until than a little clipping will be required. But this comb eliminates most of the clipping. Excellent buy!!!
customer_reviews.author: James R. Van der Veen

customer_reviews.title: A Bit Misleading ( Watch it ) no blades just stainless hooked metal brush.... Not hardly a blade to cut through mats!
customer_reviews.text: This dematting brush is only getting 3 stars because it is great for a shedding comb but for serious mats it don't cut the mustard. I complained to the seller and the best I got was a more instructions how to use it. It was misleading,,,, there are no blades to cut through the mats! I wouldn't have paid $30 for something that wasn't going to cut through the mats without pulling the cats hair! He doesn't like this any better in fact worst than the sliker brush for $5. Beware here no blades involved no offer to refund my money?
customer_reviews.author: Curious714

customer_reviews.title: She loves it!!!!
customer_reviews.text: My temperamental kitty loves it!!! She actually gets on her hind legs so that I can scratch her head with it. It really does a great job for pulling the excess fur/undercoat without being sharp. I have a domestic long hair and she was matted in several places but I was able get those out by either cutting (not recommended). This tool will help prevent any further matting issues. *I have NOT been offered any incentives or discounts to leave this review
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.R

customer_reviews.title: Worked on one cat, not on the other
customer_reviews.text: This little tool worked like a charm on a large male cat with relatively short fur. Literally five minutes and two very large matts were gone without any complaint from the cat. My daughter has a longer haired more fluffy cat, and it did not do anything for her severe matts.
customer_reviews.author: Mary C

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy....
customer_reviews.text: I have Australian Shepards, a breed with double coats, and this brush was horrible. The teeth must not be very sharp because all it seems to do is pull and tear hair out, not cut through tangles. I invested in some other combs and brushes that do a lot better job than this brush. My advice is to not buy.... unless you want to thin your dog’s hair by slowly ripping its fur out.... If I could sharpen the teeth at the bottom of the U part then maybe it would be worth salvaging...
customer_reviews.author: CamiSteig

customer_reviews.title: Nice comb, but not perfect for everyone
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice product for my short haired miniature schnauzer. Unlike a typical brush, the bent comb makes it so my dog will sit still while I comb him longer than usual. *Warning: because of the curved comb mats get stuck easily and means you have to grab the hair close to the skin with your hand and then pull. If you have a longer haired dog with mats this may a bit annoying. I’ve found this to be a great primarily because my dog tends to sit still for longer while I brush him.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Congdon

customer_reviews.title: Does well but doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: Originally I would have given this 5 stars. After just one year, though, my handle has exploded and the gel is coming out and making a mess. The comb part seems to work great on reducing and eliminating minor tangles in my long haired cats. Nothing but scissors works on large tangles, especially when they are against the skin, but I've been very happy with the reduction in overall tangles from using the comb regularly. It really does a great job at removing hair during shedding season! I just wish it would last longer as I did find that the handle felt great before it started leaking goo which attracts and holds hair and makes a gross mess.
customer_reviews.author: Cat lady

customer_reviews.title: It's a nice piece and works, but not like magic.
customer_reviews.text: One of my mini Yorkies has thin smooth hair and this is great. My other has really soft, fluffy hair that mats pretty regular in a few spots. I got a big furball off of the little guy the first use, but he does not like it. Even being gentle, and holding fur in tangled areas, this doesn't slide like butter through tangles, it will pull the hair before it cuts. Just another brush he hates with a nice squishy handle. But it works. I wish the blades were sharper, the curved tips seem to work well enough for them to be made sharper.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Gormely

customer_reviews.title: Special Needs Pet Approved!
customer_reviews.text: Our Aussie was born blind and deaf and she is super sensitive to touch so teaching her to tolerate any brush/heavy petting/harness etc. requires a little bit of extra time to get used to. Australian Shepherds have a thick undercoat that can mat if not properly dealt with. This brush helps us to tame her undercoat in the shortest amount of time since she doesn’t normally last very long for certain tasks. I will say we have to distract her with a bone or toy that she can chew on while we’re brushing her, but we absolutely love this brush!
customer_reviews.author: SavvyVT

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent tool for removing matted hair from your cat
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent tool for removing matted hair from your cat. Our cat had six big matts on her back that we were unable to brush out. This worked with very little discomfort for the cat! The photo is of one of the mats prior to removal to give you an idea of what this amazing tool will work on.
customer_reviews.author: J. R.

customer_reviews.title: Really takes out the hair!
customer_reviews.text: I find this works better than any other brush, comb or stripper I've used. Two sides are available. The finer tooth side is a little intense (pulls hair) for my dog with a curly thick undercoat, but perfect for the one with straighter, finer hair. The larger tooth side works for both dogs. It's really amazing how much hair it removes. Every hair it catches is one less hair I have to clean off things later! The gel handle is comfortable, too. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Champ

customer_reviews.title: Worked great on some really tough matted fur on my Maine Coon
customer_reviews.text: My cat had developed some brutal matted fur knots around his neck (right where he couldn't get to them -- he's pretty good about cleaning himself but it was a tough spot). This tool worked like a charm -- couple times he wasn't thrilled with me having to hit the same spot a couple times to work the mat out but within minutes, the fur came right out. Definitely a well built tool, and saved me bringing my guy to the only cat groomer in the area. Well worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Take your time; an hour every day is good for heavy shedded and matted fur.
customer_reviews.text: Thank goodness for this tool! There were two other full Pomeranians in my Frankie's coat. He looks and feels so much better!! Albeit I had to do the job in stages over a few days... But end result my sweet baby looks like the star he is again and it was so easy! He didn't squeak once fearing tugs on tangles because there weren't painful moments. To achieve this you must go slow and bond with your pet. Take breaks and make brushing a pleasant experience over a few days until the pet is fully clear of mats, tangles and shedded hair.
customer_reviews.author: Little Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Good product, some provisios
customer_reviews.text: This product certainly delivers what it promises: it is easy to hold, comfortable to use, and pulls out fur at a shocking rate. Overall, it is a good product and I can recommend it to most owners of medium or large sized dogs. The bad? My Aussie seems particularly tender when being brushed and this comb drove him nuts, occasionally veering into pain. I have to use it very slowly and carefully with him and even then there are occasional yelps. I suspect a less high-strung dog would handle this better, but this was our experience.
customer_reviews.author: Old DufflerTop Contributor: DC Comics

customer_reviews.title: Great deshedding rake
customer_reviews.text: As a professional groomer it’s nice to have two tools in one to save on space and to have them work even better. This get through the gaurdcoat to remove the thick dead undercoat. I use it doing the second shampoo or while the conditioner is sitting and then after the dog is dry for best resolutes
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Claypool

customer_reviews.title: This WILL NOT remove mats from your long haired cat!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about this brush, for my Persian cats, but I've read in some reviews that Persian owners had success removing mats, from their cats... not quite. It's a very good brush, and maybe you can prevent matting of cats with long hair, but you can get that from combs at less that half the price. You WILL NOT remove matted clumps of fur from your cat with this brush, outside of him/her scratching your face off. :D. it's being marketing as some wonder brush that removes hair mats, and the video for the product is useless. I wish I could return it...
customer_reviews.author: powersurge

customer_reviews.title: No flying fur
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many and this one leaves the fur on the item (you will need to get use to the way it works). The other ones always had the fur flying in the air - this one is more contained, the fur stays on the blade (most of it anyway). That is very helpful and much neater. Also, it looks dangerous but is really gentle with the curved tips. My dog does not like to be brushed and that has not changed, but for me, I enjoy it more since I am not breathing in dog dander, fur, etc.
customer_reviews.author: zombie nut

customer_reviews.title: Great for novice and matted fur!
customer_reviews.text: Senior cat living in a senior’s apartment. Sundae no longer grooms herself and is a bit heavy to reach. My mom had trouble getting her to sit and be groomed. The mats were out of control. I was looking at a $130+ visiting groomer fee. Sundae got mad at me, but with soothing voice and determination - she is mat free and bathed. It took about an hour and a half but, working slowly, brush from undercoat with a small arc upwards and they start to shave off. I recognize that the sharpness of the blades is essential. Scissors are way too risky and I’d never risk hurting her. It worked the whole time. Very pleased with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: This comb really works
customer_reviews.text: I really like the way this comb removes excess hair from my cats. I have a Seal-Mitted Ragdoll with lots of hair and ruff, and I have a short hair (looks like Russian Blue) who has a very thick coat. Both need to be combed often and this is the best brush (including the Furminator). One slight downside is the handle. Although very comfortable, the material hangs on to a hair or two and that is very hard to remove. You can't just brush it off. I suppose I could wash it off, but nah. Too much trouble and not much of a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Munson

customer_reviews.title: Works really well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a lightning deal and am very impressed. Prior to finding this I was using the Ferminator brand which works well, but is very expensive (FYI my Ferminator actually broke after a year). This rake is substantially less money and I think it's faster than the Ferminator; it takes me about 5 minutes to completely brush my golden retriever.
customer_reviews.author: Rob the ToolmanTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Used product
customer_reviews.text: It came with fur in the brush and I can't remove it. For this reason I'm returning it. We didn't use it. I didn't like the idea of a used item.
customer_reviews.author: M Jamison

customer_reviews.title: Just OK for my Poms
customer_reviews.text: The brush gets stuck alot and requires that I grab the first at the base every stroke. I have 4 Poms and this will take forever. This is my first brushing with it so perhaps after the first time it will be easier and more comfortable for my picky Poms. They hate having their hair pulled. This brush really does a great job of getting into the second coat and removing and holding it until removal. I just wish it went through smoothly without pulling so much.
customer_reviews.author: The Bibbs

customer_reviews.title: Best grooming brush ever
customer_reviews.text: I have two very large shorthair cats that have a second undercoat. I have purchased so many grooming brushes all saying the same thing that " I will never need to buy another." So I was skeptical but this is the real deal. I can't tell you what a difference it has made to grooming my cats. Just like the videos, when I use it there are literally handfuls of hair that come off them. It really is the last grooming brush I will ever need to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jillane

customer_reviews.title: Terrific !
customer_reviews.text: I have a bunch of Ragdoll cats (they have long fur). One has silky fur & a regular brush will go through it, doing a pretty good job. Two are minks, with incredibly thick fur & I can't believe how well this works on them ! I haven't had to deal with mats, so can't speak to that,but this really works well on thick fur..... hoping it cuts down on how much I have to vacuum. Oh-the cats seem to like it, which is nice as well.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra H. Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Not gentle
customer_reviews.text: I have two Australian Shepherds. Based on reviews, I thought I would give it a try. One dog likes to be brushed, but she couldn't get away from this thing fast enough! It clearly pulled. It did not do anything good. The other dog doesn't like to be brushed anyway, and I was hoping that this would be miraculously gentle and create cooperation. Instead, it set back our progress by weeks. He is so afraid of it because it pulled. Such a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: shay

customer_reviews.title: Works better than any other product I've tried.
customer_reviews.text: Finally, I got that dang mat out of my long-haired cat's coat! Nothing else has worked and it was frustrating for both of us. This works better than any tool I've used on any of my pets. I'm getting balls of fur out in no time. My 2 short-haired cats like it too. I didn't realize I could even get much hair out of them, but this proved me wrong. I don't know what they're thinking with the handle, though. It's a clever gimmick (soft and squishy), but it's not necessary and hair clings to it (gross). This seems like the kind of stuff that will get sticky with time too. I'd rather not deal with that.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi Isberg

customer_reviews.title: A must for long-haired cats
customer_reviews.text: This has been great for my cat. He is half mainecoon cat and his fur is LONG. He gets tangles and mats really easily and this takes them out very effectively. Keep in mind - once a mat has become really big and is really close to the skin, this is not a good option. Use this on small mats so that you can get rid of them before they become big mats.
customer_reviews.author: -Jes-

customer_reviews.title: A Serious Grooming Rake
customer_reviews.text: I really respect this GoPet DeMatting Rake. This is definitely a professional grooming tool. I am used to dog combs, with the nylon tipped bristled brushes....well this is totally different, and requires focused attention when grooming your pet. We have a young Golden Retriever pup, and this GoPet DeMatting Rake works well on her coat, getting that undercoat. I am taking it slowly, to get her used to it, but it is definitely an effective grooming tool. Results to date are great. A high quality grooming tool. Easy to hold too. Cheers
customer_reviews.author: SavvyOnyx

customer_reviews.title: Hurts my doodle and my lab as well as my cats
customer_reviews.text: I bought this due to so many good reviews indicating it is better than the furminator. Well, it is not better. My doodle , my lab and my two cats were in pain, the blades pull the hair tight before cutting or more like ripping them off. I cannot recommend this product for its intended purpose. Yes, the handle is comfortable to hold but that is the only plus of this dematter. It will go back...
customer_reviews.author: Mom of three

customer_reviews.title: The best, the best, the best!
customer_reviews.text: Love this, it works great, the pets don't mind it like they do with some & the best of all is the handle, it's like squishy gel filled, I end up holding it even when I'm done using it just squeezing & playing with the handle because it feels so good in your hand. It would also work very well for someone with arthritis or having a hard time gripping small things because this is a thick and squishy handle that forms to your hand. I would recommend. Good job!
customer_reviews.author: A🦋

customer_reviews.title: This Really Works
customer_reviews.text: My one female (long-haired Himalayan) cat has the type of fur that mats ... it's not as silky as my boy. She tends to get them on her hindquarters and she's a bit "tender" back there. Purchased this brush on recommendation of other longhaired "cat folks" with same problems and glad I did. I am having success removing (little by little) some of those tight mats she gets. She seems to be tolerating it more than the comb. I find with her ... best to do this after she awakens from her 4-hour nap and she's sleepy still! I would recommend this brush.
customer_reviews.author: Cat Lover

customer_reviews.title: Does not remove mats from cats as described
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in hopes that it would help remove several small mats from the side of my cat. This tool did not work. I ended up removing them with the furminator. I was hoping for something a little more gentle but honestly the furminator works the best. Target the mat, and with a few swift strokes it yanks right out. He hates that thing but it works wonders. I was hoping for something a little more gentle so I tried this but this is just like a mini rake and it doesn't even remove much regular hair, let alone matted hair.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica M

customer_reviews.title: Not effective for my Maine Coon
customer_reviews.text: I've bought a few brushes and combs for my cats on amazon over the years and this one is the least effective. I can see how it would be useful if you have a matting problem, but this item feels useless in the toolkit of someone who regularly grooms their cats. It doesn't de-shed effectively at all, isn't all that relaxing to them, and doesn't function much in the way of standard brushing either. Not for me or my cats with long or short fur.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised quality!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this brush to use on my goldendoodles impossible coat because other brushes just weren't doing the job well enough, and after this brush I can say I will never use anything different! It works exactly as I was hoping it would. This brush really gets the undercoat so well. And as doodles often do, my dog has a few mats. But with this brush, I was able to work through them which I was so excited about. I would absolutely recommend this product to others.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Wood

customer_reviews.title: not sharp enough to do its job
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a good idea but cutters aren't sharp enough to cut the mat from our golden retriever. His coat is extremely thick and oily so matted fur happens almost daily. We really hoped this type tool would work, but it's ineffective. We went back to scissors. The gel handle had such rave reviews we thought it must be great, but both of us think it feels almost creepy. Very gushy. I didn't expect it to feel like a bag of jelly. We'll add it to our collection of learning experiences. Maybe it'll work on a future dog.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work as well as a Furminator
customer_reviews.text: I love the concept of this brush, but it doesn’t work as well as a Furminator on my long hair border collie. The brush cannot do long strokes through thick fur; you must do tiny little strokes. Otherwise the brush snags painfully. I was also hoping this would cut up small mats but it gets caught on them too. It does pull out a lot of bottom coat hair, leaving top coat undisturbed, just not as easy as a long hair Furminator does.
customer_reviews.author: corey

customer_reviews.title: Simply doesnt work
customer_reviews.text: Simply doesnt work. Tried on both of my dogs. One has very thick fluffy fur with an undercoat. One has thin, straight, wispy fur. This did nothing on either one. It just pulled their fur and made them uncomfortable
customer_reviews.author: LCS

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is “wow” to this comb! It got so much hair out of the undercoat from our dog and dematted well. It does feel more challenging to comb through areas with curly hair, but it got better when I went with short strokes and held the area down with the other hand. Another thing I love is the handle- it’s soooo comfy. This is a great one for dogs with double coats.
customer_reviews.author: PS

customer_reviews.title: I have a very long haired cat who gets terrible knots and mats
customer_reviews.text: I have a very long haired cat who gets terrible knots and mats. It seemingly happens overnight sometimes, and of course he loves to roll around on the ground which only makes it worse. I thought to remove a couple of them I was going to have to shave him, but then I found this. It works great, and has allowed me to remove even the hardest knots. They do have a tendency to really grab and pull though, sometimes before you are ready, so it can end up hurting the cat. Just something you need to watch out for. Aside from that I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Unwanted solicitation

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for a super fluffy Chow/German Shepherd
customer_reviews.text: Holy cow, this brush is amazing! My long haired super floofy Chow/German Shepherd starts to blows her coat and then it immediately starts to mat. I've tried lots of brushes but this is the first one that worked! Pulled the mats out of her butt fluff easily and I didn't have to give her a terrible mom diy haircut! Lena is 13, I wish I would have found this years ago. Bonus the handle is the nicest gel and feels great and allows a good grip! Sidenote: I also tried this on my super sheddy but shorter haired husky and it didn't really do much. A regular rake type brush works better for that kind of fluff.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Fitzsimmons

customer_reviews.title: Best Thing Ever
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as one of my cats does not like getting brushed. His coat stayed fine, but he was prone to hairballs, which must have been painful internally, and when he barfed them up. I saw this and decided I’d give it a go. It’s perfect. My cat even lets me brush him, go figure. Still early days with regard to his hairball barfing, but I remain very optimistic. Especially if you could see the amount of fur I’ve removed. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: L GARMORY

customer_reviews.title: Best Brush for long-haired cats!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 19 yo cat which likes to stay in a bedroom. She continuously hid under the bed & wouldn’t allow anyone to touch her. She got so matted I thought we should shave her. When we tried she freaked out so much that the groomer said they couldn’t do anything. I saw a review on this & I gave it a try. It took a while but within 2 weeks all her knots were combed out & she had silky-smooth hair again. She loves the brush & isn’t hiding under the bed any more!
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves this and so do I
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this and so do I. He just can't get enough of it. He has longer hair and does not groom himself very much. He gets these mats that I've had to trim out in the past, even with brushing. I can already see a difference after the first use and he just keeps getting softer and better looking. It seems like it is getting the mats out while they are still somewhat small. I've tried a lot of different products but his one is hands down the best. I even tried this on myself before using on my cat and it seems pretty comfortable. The handle is nice and comfortable too.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I have a new rescue who is terrified of being brushed, groomed, any touching! We are learning day by day. But i saw this and oh my goodness it does a great job! in the 110* phoenix heat this was perfect to help start getting some of those unneeded layers out. It was so easy to use and he didn't freak out about this brush as he did with the regular one! LOVE IT!!
customer_reviews.author: Katie Souris

customer_reviews.title: BEST grooming comb I've ever usesd
customer_reviews.text: I have a long haired cat who had some nasty mats. The comb I had wasn't getting them, just hurting him. I got this and wow..it really works. The grip is soft and comfortable and he's actually been coming to me to use it. I'm happy to say the mats are gone and he keeps coming just to be brushed. I don't usually write reviews, but I'm so happy I got this..yes it's pricey, but it works!
customer_reviews.author: Kizmet

product_meta.title: GoPets Dematting Comb with 2 Sided Professional Grooming Rake for Cats & Dogs
feature_bullets: THE ORIGINAL PROFESSIONAL QUALITY DEMATTING TOOL. Comfortably and quickly get a professionally groomed look in minutes.

CLEAR ALL DIFFERENT MATS AND TANGLES. The double sided pet comb has a different number of teeth on each side. The lower density side is a dematting rake for stubborn matts and tangles. The higher density side is a detangler, deshedding tool, or undercoat rake for faster results thinning and to control shedding.

MULTIPLES USES WITH JUST ONE COMB. The pet grooming tool not only works great as a dematting brush or detangling comb, but also as an undercoat comb or deshedding rake. The dematting tool for dogs and cats can comb to cut a matt or tangle then be used as a deshedding brush or deshedding comb

A MORE COMFORTABLE AND PLEASANT EXPERIENCE. The cat and dog brush has sharp teeth to prevent pulling hairs and the rounded ends help make it safer on sensitive skin as an undercoat brush. The non-slip silicone gel filled handle conforms to your hand no matter how you hold it makes it a unique dog and cat brush.

STOP HURTING YOUR FURRY FRIENDS. Sharp stainless steel blades cut through mats and tangles instead of pulling the hair out. Plus all of the teeth have dull rounded ends so it will not scratch or irritate your pet’s skin.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
